titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 206
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

msDesc.head: Theological miscellany (Bernard of Clairvaux, Lotharius dei Conti di Segni)

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, 1-278. domine obsecro complaceat tibi

collation.p: The last leaf of quire 1 () has been detached and subsequently glued to the first leaf of quire 2 (), while the stubs of the missing first two leaves of quire 2 are clearly visible. Consistently with this, there is a break in the text between and .
collation.catchwords: Catchwords on quires 2-10, 13-16 (14 and 15 only partially visible due to trimming), and 22.

p.note: Top of page, in ink by a conteporary hand over 5 lines, a table of contents: In isto volumine continetur tractatus infrascripti Primo Sermones Beatis Bernhardi de toto anno Item acta consilii Basilensis Item tractatus de arte moriendi Item tractatus de miseria humane condicionis; bottom right corner: National Library book label with the current signum.

Top of page, in ink in the hand of Hyltén-Cavallius: 1734 års Katal. Theol. in folio, no 23.; centre page, in the same hand: a table of contents with the folio numbers added in pencil in a different hand, I Sermones beati Bernhardi Abbatis de adventu domini et de toto anno fol. 1-20 II Acta Sacri Basilensis concilii fol. 201-253 III Tractatus de arte moriendi fol. 236-263 IV Liber Lotharii dyaconi Cardinalis qui postea Innocentius papa IIIus appelatus est De miseria humanae condicionis fol. 264-277, and an addition in pencil below, V predikoturer för var månad 1435, 1436, och 1437.

binding.p: Medieval binding. Brown leather over wooden boards. 5 double raised bands and endbands. Hooked clasps with straps of green fabric. Decorated centre and corner bosses. , in ink on a paper label: In hoc volumine contin. 1 Sermones beati Bernhardi 2 Acta concilii Basil. 3 Tract. de arte moriendi 4 miseria humanae condicionis and, on top of this, 96; in ink on a paper label: No 23 1. Sermones Bernhardi 2. Acta Concilii Basil. etc.; stamped in gold: the current signum, A 206; in ink on a paper label: BERNHARDI sermones etc 23; in ink on a paper label pasted on top of the remnants of another paper label: e. 30. 3. 10..

decoNote.p: Blind tooled panels with lozenge patterns inside on and .

binding.condition: The leather is worn and, on , cracked along the spine with some of the bands partially exposed. One of the fabric straps has been replaced with modern leather.

origin.p: 15th century. Origin and provenance unknown. Three of the four watermarks found in Unit 2 (the two gloves and the bull) are similar to watermarks found in Basel around (cf. Piccard XVII, IV, 1216; Piccard XVII, IV, 1202; and Piccard XV, VI, 939).

acquisition.p: Acquisition date unknown, but the manuscript has been at the National Library since at least the 18th century; it is listed in the catalogue of 1734 (U 125 e) as no 23 and as e. 30. 3. 10. in Hammarsköld's catalogue of the 19th century. The signum 96 on the spine has not been identified.

msItem.title: Sermons
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt sermones beati Bernhardi abbatis de aduentu domini et de toto anno

msItem.title: Sermo primus in adventu Domini
msItem.incipit: HOdie fratres celebramus aduentus domini initium
msItem.explicit: magnum est exemplum mortalibus eundi et perueniendi ad ipsum qui est benedictus in secula amen
msItem.note: From the middle of (Considerate eciam ad quid venerit), the text of the manuscript differs from that of the edition.

msItem.title: Sermo sextus in adventu Domini
msItem.incipit: NOlo vos fratres ignorare tempus visitacionis
msItem.explicit: ab exspectatione nostra saluator quem exspectamus ihesus christus dominus noster qui est super omnia benedictus in secula amen

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in adventu Domini
msItem.incipit: IN aduentu domini quem hodie celebramus
msItem.explicit: et semper indignum se iudicet et inutilem
msItem.note: The upper outer corner of has been torn off resulting in loss of text.

msItem.title: Sermo quartus in adventu Domini
msItem.incipit: DIgnum est fratres vt tota cum deuotione celebremus aduentum domini
msItem.explicit: qui pro reconciliandis sibi peccatoribus tanta sustinuit

msItem.title: Sermo quintus in adventu Domini
msItem.incipit: DIximus nuper hiis qui deargentauerunt pennas
msItem.explicit: Et alibi Prope est verbum in ore tuo et in corde tuo (Rom. 10:8)

msItem.title: Sermo XXXII de diversis
msItem.incipit: SIc nos existimet homo vt ministros christi
msItem.explicit: si vmquam racio perdiderit intencionis rectitudinem

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in vigilia nativitatis Domini
msItem.incipit: HOdie scietis quia veniet dominus et mane videbitis gloriam (Ex. 16:7) Vos qui in puluere estis
msItem.explicit: et in fide sanitas est quia qui crediderit saluus erit

msItem.title: Sermo sextus in vigilia nativitatis Domini
msItem.incipit: AVditum audiuimus plenum gracia dignum accepcione
msItem.explicit: quod offerre incensum dignum
msItem.note: The first two leves of quire 2 are missing, resulting in the loss of the end of the sermon.

msItem.title: Sermo primus in vigilia nativitatis Domini
msItem.incipit: nobis quoque estimacione faciat preciosam
msItem.explicit: et securus iam suscipe eum qui in bethlehem inde nascitur ihesum christum filium dei
msItem.note: The first two leves of quire 2 are missing, resulting the loss of the beginning of the sermon.

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in nativitate Domini
msItem.incipit: DVo quedam rerum genera fratres in hac natiuitate domini considero
msItem.explicit: auertat hoc a seruis suis qui pro eorum salute dignatus est formam serui accipere vnigenitus dei amen

msItem.title: Sermo quartus in nativitate Domini
msItem.incipit: AGnoscite dilectissimi quanta sit hodierna sollempnitas cui et dies breuis
msItem.explicit: magnificabit postmodum et glorificabit magnus et gloriosus aduentus ihesus christus

msItem.title: Sermo quintus in nativitate Domini
msItem.incipit: BEnedictus deus et pater domini nostri ihesu christi pater misericordiarum et deus totius consolacionis
msItem.explicit: verus vtique dies ex die salutare dei ihesus christus dominus noster amen

msItem.title: De festivitatibus sancti Stephani, sancti Ioannis, et Sanctorum innocentium
msItem.incipit: BEnedictus qui venit in nomine domini (Ps. 117:26) Benedictum nomen glorie eius
msItem.explicit: qui vnus cum eo verum est deus super omnia benedictus in secula

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in circumcisione Domini
msItem.incipit: POstquam consummati sunt dies octo (Gen. 17:12) Audiuimus paucis expressum
msItem.explicit: sicut ait apostolus Prouidentes bona non tantum coram deo sed eciam coram hominibus

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in circumcisione Domini
msItem.incipit: IN circumcisione domini fratres habemus quod amemus
msItem.explicit: vt nichil plus nichil minus nichil aliter quam imperatum sit faciatis

msItem.title: Sermo primus in epiphania Domini
msItem.incipit: APparuit benignitas (Tit. 3:4) Gracias deo per quem sic habundat consolacio
msItem.explicit: tot incentiuis inflammatur caritas nostra et cetera

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in epiphania Domini
msItem.incipit: TRes appariciones domini legimus vno quidem die
msItem.explicit: quale nobis expressit qui de eius corde processit

msItem.title: In epiphania (Sermones varii)
msItem.incipit: TRiplicem huius festiuitatis racionem a sanctis patribus traditam esse
msItem.explicit: vbi nullus dolor sed sempiternus honor inhabitat

msItem.title: In octava epiphaniae
msItem.incipit: POpulo dure ceruicis cultellus erat necessarius
msItem.explicit: haut dubium quin et leticia simul

msItem.title: Sermo primus in dominica prima post octavam epiphaniae
msItem.incipit: IN leccione ewangelii hodie fratres audiuimus quia dominus noster iuit ad nupcias
msItem.explicit: quia nec omnibus centuplum repromittitur

msItem.title: Sermo LV et LVI de diversis
msItem.incipit: ERant ibi sex ydrie (John 2:6) Intelligamus has sex ydrias
msItem.explicit: vt ex seruo proueharis in filium
msItem.note: Sermon 55 and 56 are presented as one text.

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in dominica prima post octavam epiphaniae
msItem.incipit: IN operibus domini fratres et minus capaces animos exterior consideracio pascit
msItem.explicit: cum timor expellitur a caritate et implentur omnia feruore spiritus et iocunda deuocione

msItem.title: In conversione sancti Pauli
msItem.incipit: MErito quidem dilectissimi conuersio doctoris gencium
msItem.explicit: mansuetudinem et humilitatem discentes a christo ihesu domino nostro cui est et sit honor et gloria in secula seculorum amen

msItem.title: Sermo primus in purificatione sanctae Mariae
msItem.incipit: HOdie templi dominum in templum domini virgo mater inducit
msItem.explicit: in corde loquitur pacem in plebem suam et super sanctos suos et in eos qui conuertuntur ad cor (Ps. 84:9)

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in purificatione sanctae Mariae
msItem.incipit: GRacias agere debemus redemptori nostro qui tam copiose preuenit nos in benediccionibus
msItem.explicit: incessanter nos corrigere in melius inperfectum vero nostrum diuine misericordie obtutibus iugiter exponamus

msItem.title: Sermo primus in septuagesima
msItem.incipit: MAgna mihi consolacio est fratres mei in verbo illo domini
msItem.explicit: Vnde et recitetur interim alleluia solempne et humane transgressionis hystoria miserabilis ab exordio recensetur

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in quadragesima
msItem.incipit: COnuertimini ad me in toto corde vestro (Joel 2:12) Quid sibi wlt dilectissimi
msItem.explicit: vt et ipsi misericordiam consequamur a domino nostro ihesu christo amen

msItem.title: Sermo primus in quadragesima
msItem.incipit: HOdie dilectissimi sacrum quadragesimale tempus ni ingredimur
msItem.explicit: vt sit eciam facies lota ab omni oleo peccatoris

msItem.title: Sermo sextus in quadragesima
msItem.incipit: OBsecro vos tamquam aduenas (1 Pet. 2:11) Felices qui presenti seculo
msItem.explicit: vt magna quedam victoria regni nostro ad gloriam nobis proueniat ad salutem

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in quadragesima
msItem.incipit: ROgo vos dilectissimi tota deuotione suscipite quadragesime ieiunium
msItem.explicit: sicut scriptum est quia in diebus ieiuniorum vestrorum voluntates vestre inueniuntur

msItem.title: Sermo quartus in quadragesima
msItem.incipit: QVia ieiunium tempus quadragesimale tempus aduenit
msItem.explicit: Vnde certum est quod numquam vacua redire possit

msItem.title: Sermo quintus in quadragesima
msItem.incipit: KAritas nuper qua pro nobis sollicitus sum
msItem.explicit: in omni humilitate presumentis de sola vt dignum est miseracione diuina

msItem.title: Sermo XXV de diversis
msItem.incipit: QVatuor michi videntur orandi modos
msItem.explicit: et quia tuo precepto commonitus tua institucione formatus id presumo domine fons pietatis

msItem.title: Sermo CVII de diversis
msItem.incipit: DIximus de generibus oracionum dicamus eciam qua puritate sit orandum
msItem.explicit: sicut testatur Petrus apostolus non est personarum acceptor acceptus est illi (Acts 10:34-35)

msItem.title: In natali sancti Benedicti
msItem.incipit: COnuenientibus uobis in vnum ad audiendum verbum salutis
msItem.explicit: temperanciam seminauerunt qui sic libidinem calcauerunt

msItem.title: Ad viros religiosos
msItem.incipit: DIxit symon petrus ad ihesum Ecce nos reliquimus omnia (Matt. 9:27) Verba leccionis huius
msItem.explicit: qui viuit vt vitam habeamus et habundanciam habeamus ihesus christus amen

msItem.title: Sermo primus in annuntiatione dominica
msItem.incipit: UT inhabitet gloria in terra nostra
msItem.explicit: docebat veritas regebat iusticia pax fouebat
msItem.note: The manuscript contains the text of the first six chapters of the edition.

msItem.title: In annuntiatione dominica
msItem.rubric: In annunciacione docet de nouem mensibus
msItem.incipit: MIssus est gabriel angelus (Luke 1:26) Gabriel missus est ad Mariam id est predicator ad peccatorem Concepcio autem fit a timore dei qui est principium boni
msItem.explicit: Ex deuocione bone operacionis procedit lac saturietatis ex dulcedine contemplacionis lac iocunditatis

msItem.title: Sermo sextus in assumptione beatae Mariae
msItem.incipit: AVe gracia plena Non in sola virginitate
msItem.explicit: quod ex te nascetur sanctum vocabitur filius dei (Luke 1:35)

msItem.title: In annunciatione sanctae Mariae
msItem.rubric: In annunciacione sancte marie de verbis ysaie
msItem.incipit: ANgelus presumpsit similitudinem dei dicens
msItem.explicit: et sapienciam nostram vt sumenti possit esse proficium

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in annuntiatione dominica
msItem.incipit: QVam diues es in misericordia
msItem.explicit: ne a ructantibus quidem poterunt fastidiri

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in ramis palmarum
msItem.incipit: NEcesse est vt loquamur hodie breuius
msItem.explicit: sanctam ciuitatem ingredi mereamur cum ipso amen

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in ramis palmarum
msItem.incipit: CVm vniuersa fecerit deus
msItem.explicit: donec requiem resurreccio donec sabbatum pascha sequatur

msItem.title: Feria IV in hebdomadae sanctae
msItem.incipit: UIgilate fratres animo ne infructuose pertranseant vos
msItem.explicit: ad mensuram bonam et confertam et coagitatam quam dabis nobis in sinus nostros qui es in sinu patris amen

msItem.title: In cena Domini
msItem.incipit: Hii sunt dies quos obseruare debemus
msItem.explicit: graciam non amittamus quam nobis tantopere et tam multifarie necessariam esse sentimus

msItem.title: Sermo primus in resurrectione Domini (alia recensio)
msItem.incipit: UIcit leo de tribu iuda (Rev. 5:5) Vbi modo sunt qui dicebant
msItem.explicit: vt ministracio mea et michi et nobis sit in salutem

msItem.title: Sermo primus in resurrectione Domini
msItem.incipit: UIcit leo de tribu iuda (Rev. 5:5) Vicit maliciam sapiencia
msItem.explicit: et in galileam vocare dignatur vt se ipsum nobis ostendat qui est super omnia AMEN
msItem.note: The larger part of torn out.

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in resurrectione Domini
msItem.incipit: Accepimus ab apostolo habitare christum per fidem
msItem.explicit: negligentiam suam prodens venite inquit et videte locum vbi positus erat dominus (Matt. 28:6)

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in resurrectione Domini
msItem.incipit: SIcut in corporum medicina prius purgaciones adhibentur
msItem.explicit: Postquam vero coram eis ascendit ad patrem iam cepit sapiencia declarari

msItem.title: Sermo quartus in resurrectione Domini
msItem.incipit: OMnia que de saluatore legimus
msItem.explicit: de communi aduersario triumpharent et conculcarent sathan sub pedibus suis

msItem.title: Sermo CXI de diversis
msItem.incipit: ETernam celestis patrie ad quam nostra suspirat peregrinacio felicitatem
msItem.explicit: nos peducat dominus virtutum rex glorie qui est via veritas et vita ihesus christus dominus noster

msItem.title: Sermo primus in octava paschae
msItem.incipit: OMne quod notum est ex deo vincit mundum
msItem.explicit: eo miserante qui pro discipulis hoc ipsum orare dignatus est ihesu christo domino nostro

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in octava paschae
msItem.incipit: EPistola beati Iohannis hodie nobis est leccio recitata
msItem.explicit: si contines a peccatis si digne agis penitencie fructus et facis opera vite

msItem.title: Sermo primus in resurrectione Domini (excerpt)
msItem.incipit: DIcimus tamen breuiter
msItem.explicit: nos quoque post se trahere dignetur in celestem galileam qui viuit et regnat AMEN

msItem.title: Sermo ad pastores in synodo congregatos
msItem.incipit: REuerendissimi patres et domini ecce lecta sunt verba
msItem.explicit: naciones et dominabuntur populis
msItem.note: The larger part of has been torn out and the last few lines of the sermon are completely missing.

msItem.title: In rogationibus
msItem.incipit: qui diligit iniquitatem (Ps. 10:6)
msItem.explicit: vt diligam vt faciam voluntatem tuam Sic enim vivitur et in talibus vita spiritus mei (Isa. 38:16) dicente scriptura quoniam vita in voluntate eius (Ps. 29:6)
msItem.note: The larger part of has been torn and everything but a few incomplete lines is missing.

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in ascensione Domini
msItem.incipit: SOlempnitas ista fratres karissimi gloriosa est
msItem.explicit: quia tu es christus filius dei viui qui es AMEN

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in ascensione Domini
msItem.incipit: HOdie celorum dominus celorum alta celesti potencia penetrauit
msItem.explicit: qui nos induat in omnem sicut dei promisit filius veritatem

msItem.title: Sermo quartus in ascensione Domini
msItem.incipit: SI natiuitatis et resurreccionis dominice digna deuocione celebramus
msItem.explicit: absque te que preparasti diligentibus te (Isa. 64:4)

msItem.title: Sermo sextus in ascensione Domini
msItem.incipit: HOdie sedenti in throno continuo
msItem.explicit: vt una substancia sic et eadem nichilominus gloria in secula seculorum amen

msItem.title: Sermo primus in ascensione Domini
msItem.incipit: REcumbentibus vndecim discipulis (Mark 16:14) Multam enim fiduciam prestat
msItem.explicit: operibus bonis operient et hoc remedio curabuntur
msItem.note: The upper outer corner of has been torn off resulting in loss of text.

msItem.title: De cruce Christi et diaboli
msItem.rubric: In inuencione sancte crucis de cruce christi et cruce dyaboli
msItem.incipit: UOlumus scire vt sciamus
msItem.explicit: Diligere proximum mercedem gracie Diligere deum mercedem glorie

msItem.title: Sermo primus in die pentecostes
msItem.incipit: CElebramus hodie dilectissimi spiritus sancti solempnitatem
msItem.explicit: si tamen iuxta apostoli monita seminatum fuerit dum adhuc est animale

msItem.title: In die pentecostes
msItem.incipit: COngregati estis fratres karissimi ad audiendum verbum dei
msItem.explicit: et vnitatis consiliarius non ignorat astucias eius

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in die pentecostes
msItem.incipit: QVam libenter vobis communicem
msItem.explicit: propter promissam stabilitatem ad laudem et gloriam sponsi domini nostri ihesu christi qui es amen

msItem.title: Sermo XLV de diversis
msItem.incipit: BEata illa et sempiterna trinitas pater et filius et spiritus sanctus
msItem.explicit: Est caritas de corde puro conscia bona fide non ficta (1 Tim. 1:5)

msItem.title: Epilogus in sermone XLV
msItem.incipit: Octo sunt trinitates
msItem.explicit: et sic habemus octo trinitates

msItem.title: In nativitate sancti Ioannis baptistae
msItem.incipit: SIt procul ab hiis conuenientibus vel conuentibus
msItem.explicit: et volo illud in vase tucius quam in lampade possidere

msItem.title: In nativitate sancti Ioannis baptiste (excerpt)
msItem.incipit: GAudeamus dilectissimi in natiuitate beati Iohannis
msItem.explicit: et volo illud vase lampadis tucius possidere

msItem.title: In vigilia apostolorum Petri et Pauli
msItem.incipit: IN sanctorum vigiliis necesse vigilare
msItem.explicit: vt ipsi nobis propicium suum reddant amicum iudicem nostrum qui est amen

msItem.title: Sermo primus in sollemnitate apostolorum Petri et Pauli
msItem.incipit: GLoriosa solempnitas nobis illuxit
msItem.explicit: et reliquerunt omnia propter te et nomen sanctum tuum

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in sollemnitate apostolorum Petri et Pauli
msItem.incipit: SAncti isti quorum solempnitatis hodie passio celebratur
msItem.explicit: et hereditatem semen christi et apostolorum nepotes

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in sollemnitate apostolorum Petri et Pauli
msItem.incipit: MErito fratres apostolis sanctis attribuit mater ecclesia sancta
msItem.explicit: cum euanuit presumpta temeritas et cetera vt supra In sermone de verbo Isti sunt viri nomine

msItem.title: Sermo primus in dominica VI post pentecosten
msItem.incipit: MIsereor super turbam (Mark 8:2) Ewangelium fratres ob hoc scriptum est
msItem.explicit: panis est eucharistia quoniam inquit panem quem ego dabo caro mea est pro mundi vita (John 6:52)

msItem.title: De misericordiis
msItem.incipit: MIsericordias domini in eternum cantabo (Ps. 88:2) Ut quid enim mihi insipiens
msItem.explicit: de tua tociens experta bonitate vsque ad celestia

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in dominica VI post pentecosten
msItem.incipit: SCitis quid fecerim septem nobis hodie misericordias
msItem.explicit: vsque ad conspectum glorie magni dei qui est benedictus in secula

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in labore messis
msItem.incipit: FAbor iste fratres exilii et paupertatis nostre
msItem.explicit: Heu michi quia incolatus meus prolongatus est

msItem.title: De altitudine et bassitudine cordis ex occasione praecedentis sermonis
msItem.incipit: DE eo quod nuperrime dictum est
msItem.explicit: quia si spiritu facta carnis mortificauerimus viuemus si vero secundum carnem vixerimus moriemur

msItem.title: Sermo primus in assumptione beatae Mariae
msItem.incipit: UIrgo hodie gloriosa celos ascendens
msItem.explicit: sed et meliores edificentur ad profectum conuersacionis

msItem.title: Sermo quartus in assumptione beatae Mariae
msItem.incipit: INtrauit ihesus (Luke 10:38) Quid est fratres quod e duobus sororibus tantum altera legitur dominum excepisse
msItem.explicit: ecce quem amas infirmatur et nos maneamus hic die isto

msItem.title: Sermo quartus in assumptione beatae Mariae
msItem.incipit: TEmpus est loquendi fratres verbum cum assumitur verbi mater in celum
msItem.explicit: per te regina clemens gracie sue munera largiatur Ihesus christus in secula

msItem.title: Sermo quintus in assumptione beatae Mariae
msItem.incipit: INtrauit Ihesus (Luke 10:38) Quod dominus ac saluator noster semel in vno loco
msItem.explicit: et ab aliis se diligi sine dubio credat

msItem.title: Dominica infra octavam assumptionis
msItem.incipit: SIgnum magnum apparuit (Rev. 12:1) Vehementer quidem nobis dilectissimi
msItem.explicit: puella es preelecta et preparata altissimi filio qui es amen

msItem.title: In nativitate beatae Mariae
msItem.incipit: FEcunde virginitatis amplectitur celum
msItem.explicit: inter lilia non inuentum quidquid illud quod inter marie manus inuenerit

msItem.title: Sermo XXIII de diversis
msItem.incipit: MAgister gentium paulus ex occasione ipsius spiritualis nature
msItem.explicit: ac spirituali materia mentes maioris longitudinem sermonis aliquatenus oneremus

msItem.title: Sermo XXIV de diversis
msItem.incipit: TEnetis credo quemadmodum hesterno sermone
msItem.explicit: vbi necesse est aut potenter implere aut sustinere pacienter

msItem.title: Sermo primus in commemoratione sancti Michaelis
msItem.incipit: ANgelorum hodie memoria celebratur
msItem.explicit: que poterit non inutilis fore si capitulum presens altero sermone sequamur

msItem.title: Sermo primus in festivitate omnium sanctorum
msItem.incipit: FEstiuitas omnium sanctorum hodie celebratur
msItem.explicit: ab omni dilacione percipitur Quod nobis largiri dignetur qui cum diues pro nobis pauper factus est vt nos sua ditaret inopia ihesus christus amen

msItem.title: Sermo quintus in festivitate omnium sanctorum
msItem.incipit: FEstiua nobis est dies hec
msItem.explicit: cum tam excelso capite membra concurrant et laudetur cum hereditate sua christus ihesus amen

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in festivitate omnium sanctorum
msItem.incipit: QVia sanctorum omnium festiuam hodie dilectissimi
msItem.explicit: Quod ergo restat adhuc de eadem materia sermoni alteri reseruemus

msItem.title: Sermo tertius in festivitate omnium sanctorum
msItem.incipit: ADuertistis ni fallor ex hiis
msItem.explicit: nec tamquam hospites et aduenas a secreta illa habitacione sua censeant repulsandos

msItem.title: Sermo quartus in festivitate omnium sanctorum
msItem.incipit: CVm de altari illo celesti
msItem.explicit: quasi sportas pro singulis panibus recipere mereamur

msItem.title: Sermo primus in dominica in Kalendis novembris
msItem.incipit: Uidi dominum sedentem super solium
msItem.explicit: et ipsa consideracionem desiderare uidentur sufficiat hodie uel cepisse

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in dominica in kalendis novembris
msItem.incipit: PLena erat omnis terra (Isa. 6:3) contemplator noster ait
msItem.explicit: quia gloriam contemplantur domini nostri ihesu christi amen

msItem.title: In festivitate sancti Martini episcopi
msItem.incipit: P Vto sermonem hunc a nobis expetit
msItem.explicit: Desidero requiem sed non recuso laborem fiat uoluntas tua

msItem.title: In natali sancti Clementis
msItem.incipit: PReciosa in conspectu domini mors sanctorum eius
msItem.explicit: terciam si ad eam peruenire merueris potat animam sicientem

msItem.title: In vigilia sancti Andreae apostoli
msItem.incipit: SAnctorum festa precipua
msItem.explicit: thesaurus nobis repositus est in ea si fuerit qui fodiat et perscrutetur

msItem.title: Sermo primus in natali sancti Andreae
msItem.incipit: CElebrantes hodie gloriosum triumphum
msItem.explicit: pericula oracione euadimus prestante domino nostro ihesu christo amen

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in natali sancti Andreae
msItem.incipit: BEati Andree apostoli festiuitas hodie celebratur
msItem.explicit: quam pro ipsius nomine tulimus feliciter consumari qui est amen

msItem.title: Sermo XVI de diversis
msItem.incipit: ET perpensius studium et cura vigilantior
msItem.explicit: meditacio cordis mei in conspectu tuo semper

msItem.title: Sermo in illud Sapientiae, VII, 30, 1: Sapientia vincit malitiam. Attingit ergo a fine usque ad finem fortiter, et disponit omnia suaviter
msItem.incipit: SApiencia vincit maliciam (Wisd. 7:30) sicut sapiencia sapor boni
msItem.explicit: Scimus quoniam diligentibus deum omnia cooperantur in bonum (Rom. 8:28)

msItem.title: Sermo primus in dedicatione ecclesie
msItem.incipit: FEstiuitas hodierna fratres tanto nobis debet
msItem.explicit: hinc alio sermone nobis tractandum erit quod dominus ipse donauerit

msItem.title: Sermo secundus in dedicatione ecclesiae
msItem.incipit: OLym rex gloriosus
msItem.explicit: a quibus nos superna sua proteccione custodiat Qui est benedictus in secula amen

msItem.title: Ad clericos de conversione
msItem.incipit: Ad audiendum vt credimus verbum dei
msItem.explicit: non peribit in finem Ipsa goria et nunc et semper in secula seculorum amen

msItem.title: Sermo XXX de diversis
msItem.incipit: NVsquam securitas fratres neque in celo neque in paradiso
msItem.explicit: ut a quibus de disiuncti sunt opere disiungantur sermone

msItem.title: Sermo XV de diversis
msItem.incipit: QVid in hoc mundo facimus fratres
msItem.explicit: et corporalem scilicet et mundialem viriliter sustineat diuersitatem

msItem.title: Sermo XXXIV de diversis
msItem.incipit: NOcere possunt vt vereor forte nonnullus verba
msItem.explicit: sed graciarum accio et vox exultacionis sine fine amen

watermark.term: Mount with three coupeaux, encircled with a flat base.

supportDesc.condition: Most of and and upper outer corner of and torn off. Stains from a spill of red ink on and (same bifolium). : stains from something having been crushed between the pages.

p.note: Paragraph numbers 3-6 in the margin in pencil by a modern hand, finishing with a note on the deviation of the text of the manuscript from that of the edition.
The the modern edition sermon number and/or title in pencil by the same modern hand at the beginning of each sermon.
Occasional corrections, manicules, nota marks - some including comments - and signaling of topics in ink by several medieval hands.

decoDesc.p: Main text in brown ink; rubrics in red; capitals touched in red. All rubrication ceases on ff. In several places, e.g. and , the rubrics are visible written perpendicularly in small script along the outer edge of the page as instructions for the rubricator; most of these have, however been trimmed off.

decoNote.p: : opening puzzle initial h over 8 lines in brown, red, and yellow/ochre. : plain initials over 3 lines in red ink. : space provided, but initials missing.

msItem.title: Acts of the Council of Basel, 1431-1435 (Session 1-21)
msItem.incipit: IN nomine sancte et indiuidue trinitatis feliciter Amen Censetur utique dignum et congruum prout id singulariter exposcit nimium
msItem.explicit: Omnes autem consuetudines statuta ac privilegia que hiis non conordant decretis nisi forte maiores adicerent penas esse irritas hec sancta sinodus decernit Datum in sessione publica maioris ecclesie basilensis Sollemiter celebrata dicmenseionis ix mense iunii Anno domini millesimo quadringentesimo tricesimo quinto et cetera

msItem.title: Tractatus artis bene moriendi
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de arte moriendi et cetera
msItem.incipit: Cum de presentis miseria trac exilii mortis transitus propter moriendi impericiam
msItem.explicit: Vnde vnicuique bene et secure mori volenti super omnia est necesse vt prius antequam mors occupet mori discat et cetera

author.persName: Lotario dei Conti di Segni (Innocent III)

msItem.title: De miseria humanae conditionis
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber lotharii dyaconi Cardinalis qui postea Innocentius papa iiius appellatus est de miseria humanae condicionis
msItem.incipit: DOmino patri Karissimo petro dei gracia portuensi Episcopo Lotharius indignus diaconus graciam in presenti et gloriam in futuro Modicum ocii
msItem.explicit: cauma sulphur et ignis ardens in secula seculorum Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Lotharii Cardinalis de miseria conditionis humane

supportDesc.condition: : hole with minor loss of text.

layout.note: Although not consistent with the extent of the quires, the guidelines change to dry point on . From this point on, the ruling is inconsistent - sometimes in dry point (e.g. ), sometimes in lead (e.g. ), and sometimes in ink (e.g. ). On some folios, the last three lines have also been ruled in dry point (e.g. ). In some places, no guidelines are visible (e.g. ). Additionally, the layout of differs from the other folios in that the print is significantly smaller, so that has 53 lines of text.

handDesc.handNote: Gothic cursive. (Possibly two different hands; note the shape of capital D.)

p.note: Numerous corrections, a few paragraph summaries, and nota marks in ink by at least two or three different medieval hands.
Text title in the margin in ink by a medieval hand.

Chapter titles, biblical references and corrections in ink by at least two or three medieval hands. From , some of the chapter titles are written in the upper or lower margin and keyed to the beginning of the chapter by signes-de-renvoi.

decoDesc.p: Main text in brown ink; pilcrows in brown ink.

decoNote.p: : plain initial I in outline over 6 lines in same ink as main text with minor penwork. , : plain initials in outline over 2 lines in same ink as main text, with some penwork. : space provided, but initials missing. : plain initial S over 2 lines in same ink as main text with minimal penwork. : plain initials in partial outline over 2 lines in same ink as main text and minor penwork. : plain initials over 2 lines in same ink as main text and some penwork. : slightly enlarged initials, 1.5-2 lines, in same ink as main text and minor penwork. : slightly enlarged initials, 1-2 lines, in same ink as main text and some penwork. : space provided and guide letters visible, but most of the initials missing. In some places, however, they are present and vary between the previous styles, e.g. .
